describe: Ireland, known as √âire in Irish, is a lush, green island nation located in the North Atlantic. It is renowned for its rich cultural heritage, vibrant music scene, and stunning landscapes, including rolling hills, rugged coastlines, and ancient castles. The country has a strong literary tradition and is famous for its folklore, including tales of leprechauns and fairies.

cities.name: üèù Dublin
cities.geographical_location: Located on the east coast of Ireland, along the River Liffey.
cities.climate: Dublin has a maritime climate with mild winters and cool summers.
popular_attractions: Trinity College and the Book of Kells

cities.name: üèô Cork
cities.geographical_location: Situated in the southwest of Ireland, on the River Lee.
cities.climate: Cork experiences a temperate oceanic climate with moderate rainfall throughout the year.

cities.name: üèù Galway
cities.geographical_location: Located on the west coast of Ireland, along the Atlantic Ocean.
cities.climate: Galway has a mild, wet, and windy climate, typical of the west of Ireland.
cities.famous_cuisine: Galway oysters, seafood chowder, and boxty.
